section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

melody.description: There is no melody or mood associated with this line, which may be because it is the preamble to the hymn, or is not meant to be read in any particular melody or mood

author.author: None
author.description: There is no author associated with this line, as it may be the preamble to the hymn

text: ਮੈ ਅੰਧੁਲੇ ਕੀ ਟੇਕ ਤੇਰਾ ਨਾਮੁ ਖੁੰਦਕਾਰਾ ॥
section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I am blind; Your Name, O Creator Lord, is my only anchor and support.

transliteration.text: mai andhulē kī tēk tērā nām khundakārā .

melody.description: Tilang is full of the feeling of having tried hard to impress, but the feeling that the effort made has not been appreciated. However, the atmosphere is not of anger or upset, but of brooding, as the person you are trying to impress is very dear to you.

author.author: Saint Namdev
author.description:
Saint Namdev [1270 - 1350] was born in the state of Maharashtra village of Naras-Vamani, in Satara district (presently called Narsi Namdev). His father was called Damshet, a tailor, and his mother was called Gonabai.

The main spiritual message of Saint Namdev, just like the Sikh Gurus, was to emphasise the importance of living a married householder life and that through marriage, living in the world and meditating on God, one could attain enlightenment. Sixty-one of his hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. He was also a close friend of Saint Trilochan.

text: ਮੈ ਗਰੀਬ ਮੈ ਮਸਕੀਨ ਤੇਰਾ ਨਾਮੁ ਹੈ ਅਧਾਰਾ ॥੧॥ ਰਹਾਉ ॥
section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: I am poor, and I am meek. Your Name is my only support. ||1||Pause||

transliteration.text: mai garīb mai masakīn tērā nām hai adhārā .1. rahāu .

melody.description: Tilang is full of the feeling of having tried hard to impress, but the feeling that the effort made has not been appreciated. However, the atmosphere is not of anger or upset, but of brooding, as the person you are trying to impress is very dear to you.

The main spiritual message of Saint Namdev, just like the Sikh Gurus, was to emphasise the importance of living a married householder life and that through marriage, living in the world and meditating on God, one could attain enlightenment. Sixty-one of his hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. He was also a close friend of Saint Trilochan.

section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O beautiful Lord, benevolent and merciful Lord, You are so wealthy and generous.

melody.description: Tilang is full of the feeling of having tried hard to impress, but the feeling that the effort made has not been appreciated. However, the atmosphere is not of anger or upset, but of brooding, as the person you are trying to impress is very dear to you.

author.description:

The main spiritual message of Saint Namdev, just like the Sikh Gurus, was to emphasise the importance of living a married householder life and that through marriage, living in the world and meditating on God, one could attain enlightenment. Sixty-one of his hymns are included in the Guru Granth Sahib. He was also a close friend of Saint Trilochan.

text: ਹਾਜਰਾ ਹਜੂਰਿ ਦਰਿ ਪੇਸਿ ਤੂੰ ਮਨੀਂ ॥੧॥
section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You are ever-present in every presence, within and before me. ||1||

transliteration.text: hājarā hajūr dar pēs tūn manīnh .1.

melody.description: Tilang is full of the feeling of having tried hard to impress, but the feeling that the effort made has not been appreciated. However, the atmosphere is not of anger or upset, but of brooding, as the person you are trying to impress is very dear to you.

text: ਦਰੀਆਉ ਤੂ ਦਿਹੰਦ ਤੂ ਬਿਸੀਆਰ ਤੂ ਧਨੀ ॥
section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You are the river of life, You are the Giver of all; You are so very wealthy.

transliteration.text: darīāu tū dihand tū bisīār tū dhanī .

melody.description: Tilang is full of the feeling of having tried hard to impress, but the feeling that the effort made has not been appreciated. However, the atmosphere is not of anger or upset, but of brooding, as the person you are trying to impress is very dear to you.

text: ਦੇਹਿ ਲੇਹਿ ਏਕੁ ਤੂੰ ਦਿਗਰ ਕੋ ਨਹੀ ॥੨॥
section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You alone give, and You alone take away; there is no other at all. ||2||

transliteration.text: dēh lēh ēk tūn digar kō nahī .2.

melody.description: Tilang is full of the feeling of having tried hard to impress, but the feeling that the effort made has not been appreciated. However, the atmosphere is not of anger or upset, but of brooding, as the person you are trying to impress is very dear to you.

text: ਤੂੰ ਦਾਨਾਂ ਤੂੰ ਬੀਨਾਂ ਮੈ ਬੀਚਾਰੁ ਕਿਆ ਕਰੀ ॥
section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: You are wise, You are the supreme seer; how could I make You an object of thought?

transliteration.text: tūn dānānh tūn bīnānh mai bīchār kiā karī .

melody.description: Tilang is full of the feeling of having tried hard to impress, but the feeling that the effort made has not been appreciated. However, the atmosphere is not of anger or upset, but of brooding, as the person you are trying to impress is very dear to you.

text: ਨਾਮੇ ਚੇ ਸੁਆਮੀ ਬਖਸੰਦ ਤੂੰ ਹਰੀ ॥੩॥੧॥੨॥
section: Tilang - Bhagtah Ki Bani (Teachings Of The Saints)

translation.text: O Lord and Master of Naam Dayv, You are the merciful Lord of forgiveness. ||3||1||2||

transliteration.text: nāmē chē suāmī bakhasand tūn harī .3.1.2.

melody.description: Tilang is full of the feeling of having tried hard to impress, but the feeling that the effort made has not been appreciated. However, the atmosphere is not of anger or upset, but of brooding, as the person you are trying to impress is very dear to you.
